DataElement.preferredName: Surgeon Affiliation Institution National Cancer Institute Identifier Number
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the numeric identifier assigned by the National Cancer Institute, the Federal Government's principal agency for cancer research. NCI conducts, coordinates, and funds cancer research, training, health information dissemination, and other programs with respect to the cause, diagnosis, prevention, and treatment of cancer, for the institute or organization affiliated with a surgeon, a physician who treats disease, injury, and deformity by operation or manipulation.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Surgeon Affiliation Institution National Cancer Institute Identifier
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the identifier or number assigned by the National Cancer Institute, the Federal Government's principal agency for cancer research. NCI conducts, coordinates, and funds cancer research, training, health information dissemination, and other programs with respect to the cause, diagnosis, prevention, and treatment of cancer, for the institute or organization affiliated with a surgeon, a physician who treats disease, injury, and deformity by operation or manipulation.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A physician who treats disease, injury, and deformity by operation or manipulation.:One associated with.:The buildings and organizations where healthcare services are provided.

Concepts.definition: A physician who treats disease, injury, and deformity by operation or manipulation that involves gaining access to the patient's body by incisional access.
The buildings and organizations where healthcare services are provided.

Property.preferredDefinition: NCI.  The National Cancer Institute, part of the National Institutes of Health of the United States Department of Health and Human Services, is the Federal Government's principal agency for cancer research.  NCI conducts, coordinates, and funds cancer research, training, health information dissemination, and other programs with respect to the cause, diagnosis, prevention, and treatment of cancer.  Access the NCI Web site at http://cancer.gov.:One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

Concepts.definition: The Federal Government's principal agency for cancer research. NCI conducts, coordinates, and funds cancer research, training, health information dissemination, and other programs with respect to the cause, diagnosis, prevention, and treatment of cancer. Part of the National Institutes of Health of the United States Department of Health and Human Services.
One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: groups, institutions, or clinical facilities that conduct clinical research or tests, or analyze clinical data.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the numeric identifier assigned to a clinical facility or other institution working on a clinical trial.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: groups, institutions, or clinical facilities that conduct clinical research or tests, or analyze clinical data.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.

Concepts.definition: A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: revised and updated for ISO compliance

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Please indicate the CTEP ID of the institution and Cooperative Group affiliation of the surgeon

ReferenceDocuments.description: If NCTN/NCORP Site Surgeon, please indicate the CTEP ID of the institution affiliated with the surgeon.
